intro: Weihea salvago-raggei, commonly known as the Koa tree, is a native Hawaiian tree belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a broad, spreading canopy. Its wood is highly valued for its strength and beauty, historically used by Native Hawaiians for canoe building and other crafts. The plant plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian forests, providing habitat and food for various native species.
